channel.title: Post your religion of choice and why!
channel.description:
Since there's so many debates about religion and all that, I wanted to start a topic about what your religion is and what made you have faith in this religion.
I'm a born Catholic. My parents raised me as a Roman Catholic and took me to church every Sunday to learn the ways of God. I had my First Communion, and was confirmed by St. Thomas Catholic church when I was 15. My parents have always had certain beliefs about certain situations, but it was always the Catholic way to them. Personally, I believe that there is something out there, my background forces me to believe it's God, but I do know that there is something whom created us all.
Please do not start debates on which religion is better, and please do not bash on other religions no matter the circumstances.
Post your religion here, and maybe an explanation if it is not common, and post what made you believe in this sort of religion.

item.description:
@malikz wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:24, topic:451436”]My religion of choice is… none! I don’t believe in any religion or religious scripture, I do not believe in any god either, or anything supernatural, I do not believe in anything that cannot be proven or disproved for that matter. That’s not to say that I’m saying no god exists, I am merely saying I don’t know and have absolutely no way of knowing therefore I do not hold the position that a god exists. You can call me an atheist if you like but so long as you also call me a non-stamp collector or a non-model train enthusiast.

In regards to my upbringing, I was born non-religious like everyone else on the planet into a largely non-religious household and country, where the most religious someone gets is counting themselves as a Christian due to it being culture or tradition despite not technically meeting the criteria for being a Christian, I only consider someone I meet in my country a Christian if they attend church weekly or make it known that they believe in the Christian god.

[hr]

The following content in this post merely serves as educational material, nothing more.

I’ve yet to see any so-called biblical contradictions hold water

I quote from the bible:

Deuteronomy 34 10 Since then, no prophet has risen in Israel like Moses, whom the Lord knew face to face
Exodus 33 11 The Lord would speak to Moses face to face, as one speaks to a friend. Then Moses would return to the camp, but his young aide Joshua son of Nun did not leave the tent.
Exodus 33 18-20 Then Moses said, “Now show me your glory.” And the Lord said, “I will cause all my goodness to pass in front of you, and I will proclaim my name, the Lord, in your presence. I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion. But,” he said, “you cannot see my face, for no one may see me and live.”
Genesis 32 30 And Jacob called the name of the place Peniel: for I have seen God face to face, and my life is preserved.

Matthew 27 5 So Judas threw the money into the temple and left. Then he went away and hanged himself.
Acts 1 16-18 and said, “Brothers and sisters, the Scripture had to be fulfilled in which the Holy Spirit spoke long ago through David concerning Judas, who served as guide for those who arrested Jesus. 17 He was one of our number and shared in our ministry.” (With the payment he received for his wickedness, Judas bought a field; there he fell headlong, his body burst open and all his intestines spilled out.

Isn’t that like Scientology?

Scientology has nothing to do with science and the namesake Scientology likely came about from the term Science Fiction or SciFi, due to how the nature of Scientology isn’t too dissimilar to science fiction writings.[/quote]

I’m no good in fixing quotes up so I’ll just type it out lol.

There’s a 3 fold nature of God. No man has seen “The Father”. Only Christ has revealed Himself to mankind since the beginning and is the mediator between the Father and mankind. It goes waaay deep and unless you’re actually interested in hearing me out, I’ll refuse to post a tl;tr post. I’ve done it a few times and learned my lesson lol.

Not sure what Judas has to do with any contradiction you’re trying to form though. O_o

[quote=“the elve age, post:26, topic:451436”][quote author=malikz link=topic=554320.msg4060538#msg4060538 date=1343371952]

[quote author=tyb97 link=topic=554320.msg4059969#msg4059969 date=1343335317]

I am very similar to you. I was born into a Roman Catholic family and that’s what I am. I attend a private school which is Catholic.

I believe in it because I feel there is some kind of a greater being out there. I don’t believe in everything about being Catholic anymore, however. One of the head priests in my middle school took like nearly all the money the church had and gambled it. That’s when I lost some of my faith.

That’s just losing faith in Roman Catholicism though, truly from my point of view, Christian is the way to heaven, doesn’t matter what denomination it is, as long as you believe Jesus is your savior, that’s all that matters.
[/quote]There’s more to it than that broski.
[/quote]God never intended or wanted there to be more than one denomination. He said when the end times are near that the denominations will unite and be one.

I am a theist, I really don’t know what’s out there, but I think the bible is very interesting.[/quote]

You’re right about God never wanting there to be denominations. God is about unity and peace, not separation.

However, God does outline that there will be a falling away. Only those who truly stand for Christ will unite. I’m glad you find it interesting…

Hebrews 3:15
While it is said, To day if ye will hear his voice, harden not your hearts, as in the provocation.

One thing I’d like to add. The bible is relevant until the end of time. All prophecies have/will come to pass. It’s one of the main reasons I turned my life over to God.

Realization that God is right.

Realization that He exists and I am an enemy of God.

My heart is open and willing to change, knowing I need it.

God calls out to me.

You get the picture. God destroys the prideful, and lifts up the humble. If you’re serious about seeking truth, you’ll find Him (although He isn’t far from any of us)

item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

I’m a Christian. I’m not the “stereotypical” Christian. I guess the stereotype would be someone who goes to church, listens to a priest and goes home. I’m not about that.

Let me first start off by saying (cus this’ll bother me when i write about it), I don’t go to Church. I am part of the Church. Many people believe that Church is the building, but according to the bible, that isn’t true. The Church is the group of Christians. Whenever I go to “church”, I say I am going to meeting. But for the sake of this post and readability I’ll just call it church.

Sunday morning, there is no priest, there is no clergy, there is no altar, there is no pastor, etc. Everyone is gathered around a table with a loaf of bread and a cup of wine. We sing and pray, and then a Brother - a male who is eating at the Lord’s Supper - led by the Holy Spirit, prays over the Bread and Wine, and then passes it around to all of the brothers and sisters - others who are eating at the Lord’s Supper - who eat a piece of bread and take a sip of wine. Then we go off and have sunday school etc.

We have other meetings and stuff during the week too.

If you are looking for a certain denomination or title, I guess you could say I am a branch off of the Plymouth Brethren. Here is my church’s website, www.gospelhallch.com <-- My dad made it.
